SENT.plain: Treatment of human lymphoblastoid (Daudi) cells with interferons inhibits cell proliferation in culture within 24 h
The failure of cell growth has been shown to be associated with impaired processing and decreased stability of newly replicated DNA
Because there is a close relationship between DNA replication and protein synthesis we have measured protein synthesis in intact Daudi cells
Protein synthesis declined steadily between 24 and 96 h after interferon treatment to a value which is only 20-30% of the rate in control cells
The enzyme 2',5'-oligo(A) synthetase is induced but our data do not support a role for the 2',5'-oligo(A)-activated ribonuclease in the control of translation in this system
